episodes.name: From the Village, To Girl Dad, Through Covid with Scott DeRosa
episodes.description:
On this episode of A Modern Man Podcast, I am joined by my friend Scott Derosa. Scott and I met playing volleyball this fall. He talks about his struggles growing up with a father of addiction in the panhandle of West Texas. He did not come from a diverse community, but the village that raised him taught him to love his neighbor regardless of who they are and what they look like. He then left the small town with big-city dreams just outside of Houston. He spent a few years there until he met his eventual wife. This led him to be a girl dad to 3 incredible young girls at such a young age. He made the commitment and moved to Oklahoma City in 2008, and he has been here ever since. After a decade of marriage, covid came. He thought he was changing careers and inevitably leaving Oklahoma, but the pandemic changed that. He was lucky enough to stay at his job for a few months longer than expected, but after that, he was unsure of his future. All he knows for sure is that he wants to be honest and respectful of everyone’s struggle and he understands we all need help sometimes.

episodes.name: Practicing Medicine in a Pandemic with Dr. Peter B. Stanbro
episodes.description:
On this episode of A Modern Man podcast I sit down with Dr. Peter B. Stanbro to discuss his experience throughout the Pandemic. He talks about the thousands of patients that would have been without medical care if he wasn’t proactive with his thinking about his practice. Many specialties were suffering during the pandemic, but he managed to increase his staff and patient count. He discussed some of the barriers between insurance companies and giving patients quality treatment. He finishes the podcast talking about some of the legal changes that are allowing mid-level providers such as PA’s and Nurse Practitioners to be able to branch out and create their own practices in some states therefore minimizing a doctors credentials.

episodes.name: EP. TWO | EMOTIONAL HYGIENE
episodes.description:
In this episode, Jenna Marilyn is talking about emotional hygiene — the kind you can’t see, but you definitely feel.

She unpacks the invisible buildup of emotional and energetic gunk — and the sacred responsibility of tending to your inner world the way you would your body after a sweaty hike.

Jenna shares her personal story of emotional overload, self-isolation, and the shift that changed everything:

You don’t have to avoid emotions or other people’s energy — you just have to clean yourself off.


You’ll hear about:

  • What emotional hygiene actually is — and why it’s just as essential as physical hygiene
  • The difference between emotional creators and emotional absorbers
  • Why Jenna isolated herself for months — and how she found her way back
  • The hiking metaphor that reframed her emotional experience
  • Real-life emotional messes: dumpers, overleakers, energy suckers, and more
  • Why energetic spaces are shared spaces — and how to stop making them dirty
  • Jenna’s before-and-after practices to feel clear, grounded, and like herself again


If you’ve ever left a room feeling off, questioned whether a feeling was yours, or just want to feel more you in your everyday life — this episode is your energetic invitation.


Take what you want. Leave what you don’t.

And maybe — take an emotional shower after. 


Follow jenna on social media @jennamarilyn_

Host: Jenna Marilyn


Producer: JD Ferrell


Presented by: THE Modern Podcast Network and Themodern.fm

episodes.name: EP. One | CELLULAR CERTAINTY
episodes.description:
In this episode, Jenna Marilyn is talking about decisions, doubt, and the quiet certainty that lives inside your body — even when your mind is filled with fear.

In this episode, Jenna shares a moment that shifted everything: a line from The Book of Secrets by Deepak Chopra that reminded her how deeply her body knows what to do. While the mind spins in doubt, the body moves with quiet precision. It adapts. It responds. It leads — if we let it.

She opens up about her personal experience with OCD, often called “the doubting disorder,” and how indecision shaped much of her life. What helped her break free wasn’t figuring everything out — it was choosing to move, and seeing that she was supported every time.

You’ll hear about:

  • Why certainty doesn’t have to come from logic — it can come from your cells
  • The difference between mental fear and biological wisdom
  • How the universe supports you when you move with intention
  • Why you are life — and life is built to adapt
  • A redefinition of “trusting yourself” that lives deeper than thought

If you’ve ever felt stuck in fear of the “wrong” decision, or if you’ve questioned whether you can actually trust yourself — this is your reminder:

Your body already knows.

And life will meet you the moment you move.

Follow Jenna on social media @jennamarilyn_

episodes.name: Just Jenna: A Preview Podcast
episodes.description:
Just Jenna is a space for the curious, the thinkers, the deep-feelers, and the ones who want to live with a little more meaning.

Hosted by Jenna Marilyn, this podcast weaves together personal stories, unexpected insights, and thought experiments—gathered from books, breakdowns, brilliant minds, nature, memes, and the messiness of real life. Everything is shared in hopes it expands you the way it expanded her.

It’s not about having the answers. It’s about noticing what moves you, asking better questions, and staying true to yourself. Take what you want. Leave what you don’t. And if you trip along the way… She won’t tell anyone.

Host: Jenna Marilyn

Produced by: JD Ferrell and The Modern Podcast Network
